data.title: Henryk Sienkiewicz Audio Books

data.text:
by Henryk Sienkiewicz

Available on:

Audio Download

In the 1880s, Stanislas (Stas) Tarkowski, a 14-year-old Polish boy, and Nell Rawlinson, an eight-year-old English girl, live in Port Said, Egypt, while their widowed fathers work as engineers on the Suez Canal.

by Henryk Sienkiewicz

Available on:

Audio Download (Free)

Henryk Sienkiewicz won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1905, but as he wrote in Polish many English-speakers are unfamiliar with his work. This short story collection is a sampler of five myths and legends which he collected.

by Henryk Sienkiewicz

Available on:

Audio Download (Free)

Sienkiewiczâ€™s epic novel of ancient Rome finds the Empire at the height of her power and splendor, but struggling with the madness and cruelty of the Emperor Nero.
